qas.question: In what year did IBM acquire Kenexa?
IBM made an acquisition in 2009, name it.
IBM span off its printer manufacturer in 1991, what was its name?
IBM sold two product lines to Lenovo, name them.
What was the name of the company that IBM Micro Electronics was offloaded to?
In what year did Lexmark acquire Kenexa?
What company was created by Kenexa in 2012 to manufacture printers?

plausible_answers.text: its personal computer and x86 server businesses

qas.question: What product lines were produced by Kenexa in 2012?
What company did Kenexa sell Lexmark to?
What manufacturing area was PwC a leader in?

context: IBM acquired Kenexa <b5_0>(<a0_0>2012<a0_0/>)<b5_0/> and <a1_0>SPSS<a1_0/> (2009) and PwC's consulting business (2002), spinning off companies like printer manufacturer <a2_0><b6_0>Lexmark<b6_0/><a2_0/> (1991), and selling off product lines like <b7_0>its <a3_0>personal computer and x86 server<a3_0/> businesses<b7_0/> to Lenovo (2005, 2014). In 2014, IBM announced that it would go "fabless" by offloading IBM Micro Electronics semiconductor manufacturing to <a4_0><b8_0>GlobalFoundries<b8_0/><a4_0/>, a leader in <b9_0>advanced technology<b9_0/> manufacturing, citing that semiconductor manufacturing is a capital-intensive business which is challenging to operate without scale. This transition had progressed as of early 2015[update].
